description:
## Theory
The same issue in JSON with files that are not plain happens in XML files. In the mapping the values of the JSON are referenced using [XML Path language](https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-10/). 
For the sample XML to access the value of ***param*** in RML the mapping should specify **"@param"**, instead to access ***nestedParam*** the mapping should specify **"child/@nestedParam"**. 

    <element>
	    <param>33</param>
	    <child>
		    <nestedParam>44</nestedParam> 
		</child>
    </element>
## Hands-on
### Task
Complete the mapping below for generating triplets containing the names and the surfaces.
### XML file content

    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
	<locations>
		<place>
			<features>
				<population>
					<amount>1,812</amount>
					<date>2018</date>
				</population>
				<surface>
					<units>Km2</units>
					<value>90.16</value>
				</surface>
			</features>
			<location>
				<latitude>44.9625428</latitude>
				<longitude>-74.4168577</longitude>
			</location>
			<name>Oneonta</name>
		</place>
		...
	</locations>
